page.title: 06HIGHER BLAKELOW FARM
page.content: A 17th century hill farm supporting 6 people,a retired farmer & wife,Mr & Mrs Pearson Jr and 2 children.Farm run on self-sufficient/low cost basis.Modernisation of buildings & installation of latest dairy equipment have been carried out by farmer.Well mechanised farm,5 tractors(latest cost Â£18000),digger,forager,Range Rover & Volvo car.Reduction in milk production as a result of EEC farm policy necessitates augmentation of income by 1.Rearing calves from own 2 bulls,Charolais & Hereford. 2.Rearing 160 lambs from flock of 100 breeding ewes. 3.Renting rough land to clay pigeon club & 3 local radio aerials. 4.Contract silage cutting & digging for other falmers. Long hours of hard work & astute management essential to make adequate living in this environment.
